column1: Kotelniki (Russian: Котéльники) is a town of Moscow Oblast
column3: located 22 kilometers (14 mi) southeast of the center of Moscow. Population: 32

column1: The village of Kotelniki was first mentioned in the 17th century and belonged to Golitsyns in the 19th century. It was granted town status in 2004.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as Kotelniki Town Under Oblast Jurisdiction—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: Kotelniki Town Under Oblast Jurisdiction is incorporated as Kotelniki Urban Okrug.

column2: the terminus of the Moscow Metro's Tagansko-Krasnopresnenskaya Line
column3: is located in the city. It was opened on 21 September 2015 and became the second station of the Moscow Metro in Moscow Oblast after Myakinino.
